libcal module¶

Module libcal contains the routines needed for fitting equilibrium constants and enthalpies from calorimetric data. The main function to invoke here is calfit() which handles most of the work. This is the only public function for this module.

libcal.cal_jac1()¶
libcal.cal_jac2(H, V, C, P)¶

This routine calculates the part of the jacobian that deals with the β

\[\frac{\partial Q_i}{\partial\log\beta_j} = \sum_k^E H_k \left( V_i\frac{\partial c_{i,k+S}}{\partial\log\beta_j} - V_{i-1}\frac{\partial c_{i-1,k+S}}{\partial\log\beta_j} \right)\]
Parameters:
  • H (numpy.ndarray) – The enthalpy values. Must be N-1 sized
  • V (numpy.ndarray) – The total volume of each point in the titration (initial plus titre). Must be N-sized.
  • C (numpy.ndarray) – The free concentrations array.
  • P (numpy.ndarray) – The stoichiometry array.
libcal.cal_jac3()¶
libcal.calcN(C, V)¶

C is the concentrations of the complexes only.

libcal.calcQ(V, C, H)¶

C is the concentrations of the complexes only.

libcal.calfit(logB0, Bflags, H, Hflags, P, Q, titration, method=0, **kwargs)¶

This function fits equilibrium constants for a calorimetric titration.

Parameters:
  • logB (numpy.ndarray) – 1D-array of floats representing the initial guess for the constants in the form of log10.
  • Bflags (list) – refinement flags for values in logB.
  • H (numpy.ndarray) – 1D-array of floats representing the initial guess for the enthalpy values.
  • Hflags (list) – refinement flags for values in H.
  • P (numpy.ndarray) – The stoichiometric coefficients in the usual format.
  • Q (list of numpy.ndarray) – The stoichiometric coefficients in the usual format.
  • titration (dict) – Information about the titrations. Two options are accepted: (1) The following key must be provided (a) ‘V’ (numpy.ndarray, volume of titre in mL), (b) ‘V0’ (float, the initial volume in mL), (c) ‘T0’ (numpy.ndarray, total amount of initial components in mmol), (d) buret (numpy.ndarray, concentration in the buret for each component in mmol/mL) and (e) ‘Tflags’ (list, optional) or (2)
  • method (int) – A number indicating the method to be used to mimize the objective functions. Allowed values are 0 for the algorithm by Levenberg-Marquardt (nonlinear least squares, this is the default one) and 1 for the Nelder-Mead algorithm (the simplex method).
Returns:

containing the follogin data (1) numpy.ndarray: The

refined constants, (2) the refined enthalpy values, (3) the free concentrations and (4) additional fitting data
Return type:

tuple
libcal.calfit_Honly(Q, N, H, Hflags)¶

Calculates the enthalpy values for the case when the equilibrium constants are not to be fit. This case simplifies significantly because a linear fitting is enough to find the values.

\[\textbf{Q} - \mathbf{N}^0\mathbf{H}^0 = \mathbf{N}^1\mathbf{H}^1 + \mathbf{N}^2\mathbf{H}^2 + \ldots + \mathbf{N}^x\mathbf{H}^x\]
\[q_i - \sum_{j=[0]} n_{ij} h_j = \sum_{j=[1]} n_{ij} h_j + \sum_k \left(\sum_{j=[k]} n_{ij} \frac{h_j}{h_{[k]}} \right) h_{[k]}\]
libcal.calfit_LM1(logB, Bflags, H, Hflags, P, Q, V, T, **kwargs)¶

This function fits equilibrium constants for a calorimetric titration by means of the Levenberg-Marquardt algoritm for the case when there is no refinement flag in the initial state.

Parameters:
  • logB (numpy.ndarray) – 1D-array of floats representing the initial guess for the constants in the form of log10.
  • Bflags (numpy.ndarray) – refinement flags for values in logB0.
  • H (numpy.ndarray) – 1D-array of floats representing the initial guess for the enthalpy values.
  • Hflags (list) – refinement flags for values in H.
  • P (numpy.ndarray) – The stoichiometric coefficients in the usual format.
  • Q (list of numpy.ndarray) – The stoichiometric coefficients in the usual format.
  • T (numpy.ndarray) – The analytical concentrations for the initial components in mmol/mL
Returns:

  • numpy.ndarray: The refined constants in natural logarithmic
    units
  • numpy.ndarray: The free concentrations
  • dict: Extra optional parameters
Return type:

tuple
Raises:

ValueError – If invalid parameters are passed.
